name: Blakeney to Stiffkey Coastal Walk, Blakeney

ai.summary: A demanding 36.3 km coastal hike along the North Norfolk coast from Blakeney to Stiffkey in England. The route combines exposed sea shores, tidal flats, marshes, and beach sections, offering coastal scenery, birdlife, and a challenging day of walking for experienced hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily coastal footpaths, marshland boardwalks, salt marshes, and shingle or sandy beach sections. Expect mud and soft ground in tidal zones, exposed windswept stretches, occasional woodland trails, and long, uninterrupted segments with limited shade.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, exposed coastal route. Check tide times and avoid tidal mudflats at high tide. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and layered clothing; bring waterproofs, sun protection, and plenty of water. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Tell someone your planned route and expected finish time. Be prepared for variable weather, strong winds, and potential path closures along the coast.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Fully charged phone and power bank
Emergency whistle and first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October), when daylight is longest and weather is generally milder for coastal walking.

seo.meta_description: Take on the 36.3 km coastal hike from Blakeney to Stiffkey along the Norfolk coast. A challenging day on marshes, beaches and tidal flats, ideal for experienced hikers.
